perturbation.original_text: 4.11 Ownership of GIE; No Claims Relating to GIE. Except as set forth in Section 10.01, PHLVIC and its Affiliates, as applicable, are the exclusive legal and beneficial owner of and have good and marketable title in and to the GIE and all intellectual property rights therein, free and clear of all pledges, claims, liens, charges, encumbrances and security interests of any kind or character, including any claims for infringement of intellectual property rights. For the purposes of this Section, intellectual property includes GIE forms, specimen forms, the features of the GIE, materials filed by any of the PHL Parties with State insurance regulators, and any other forms prepared by any of the PHL Parties or any of their Affiliates in connection with the GIE. There are no claims, actions, suits, investigations or proceedings (arbitration or otherwise) pending against, or to the knowledge of PHLVIC, threatened against or affecting, all or any part of the GIE
perturbation.changed_text: 4.11 Ownership of GIE; No Claims Relating to GIE. Except as set forth in Section 10.01, PHLVIC and its Affiliates, as applicable, may be considered the owner of and have title in and to a portion of the GIE and certain intellectual property rights therein, subject to potential claims, liens, charges, encumbrances and security interests. For the purposes of this Section, intellectual property potentially includes GIE forms, specimen forms, the features of the GIE, materials filed by any of the PHL Parties with State insurance regulators, and any other forms prepared by any of the PHL Parties or any of their Affiliates in connection with the GIE. There may be claims, actions, suits, investigations or proceedings (arbitration or otherwise) pending against, or to the knowledge of PHLVIC, threatened against or affecting, all or any part of the GIE
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that PHLVIC and its affiliates are the exclusive owners of the GIE and all related intellectual property. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating they 'may be considered the owner' and that ownership is 'subject to potential claims,' creating a contradiction that could impact the enforcement of intellectual property rights.

perturbation.original_text: 11.01.1 Each Party shall perform, and shall cause each of its respective Affiliates, as applicable, to perform, their respective duties and obligations under the Transaction Documents in compliance in all material respects with applicable Law.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.01.1 Each Party shall endeavor to perform, and shall cause each of its respective Affiliates, as applicable, to perform, their respective duties and obligations under the Transaction Documents without strict compliance with all applicable Law.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that each party must perform their duties in compliance with applicable law. The modified version contradicts this by stating the parties should perform their duties 'without strict compliance with all applicable Law.' This directly conflicts with the original intent and creates uncertainty about the parties' legal obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 13.03 No Third-Party Beneficiaries. This Agreement, the Selling Agreement, and the Memorandum of Understanding are solely among the Parties hereto, as applicable, and are not intended to create any right or legal relationship, express or implied, among the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, representatives, successors or permitted assigns, on the one hand, and any third party, including any Certificate Owner or other person covered under a GIE, on the other hand; provided, however, that the Investors Capital Indemnitees and the PHL Indemnitees are expressly intended to be third-party beneficiaries under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.03 No Third-Party Beneficiaries. This Agreement, the Selling Agreement, and the Memorandum of Understanding may or may not have third-party beneficiaries, dependent on interpretation by legal counsel. While not intended to create any right or legal relationship, express or implied, among the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, representatives, successors or permitted assigns, on the one hand, and any third party, including any Certificate Owner or other person covered under a GIE, on the other hand; provided, however, that the Investors Capital Indemnitees and the PHL Indemnitees may or may not be considered third-party beneficiaries under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that no third-party beneficiaries exist, except for specifically named groups. The revised text adds phrases like "may or may not have third-party beneficiaries" and "may or may not be considered third-party beneficiaries" that directly conflict with the assertion that there are *no* third-party beneficiaries, creating ambiguity.
